column6: Parental leave
column13: Magellan's Paid Parental Leave Policy provides up to 15 to 18 weeks (depending on the length of employment) for permanent employees who have the primary responsibility for the care of their child and who have worked for Magellan for at least 12 months continuously at the time of the birth or adoption of that child. Employees receive superannuation payments on their paid and unpaid portion of parental leave for the first 12 months. Employees on paid parental leave are eligible for the annual remuneration review and variable incentive whilst on leave.
column20: Paid Parental Leave Policy, Family, Work-life Balance

column6: Parental leave
column13: In addition, if an employee returns to work during paid parental leave, Magellan will continue to spend the remaining paid parental leave in addition to their base salary and other entitlements. Magellan offers a "Keep in Touch" program for employees who are on paid parental leave.
column20: Keep in touch program, salary, paid leave

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: In addition, Magellan maintains a Work Health & Safety Policy that outlines the obligations and responsibilities of Magellan and its employees regarding compliance with the Work Health & Safety regulation and ensuring that the workplace remains a safe environment for all employees.
column20: Work Health and Safety Policy, safe environment, employee

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
Occupational health services
column7: Magellan provides our staff with several health and wellbeing initiatives, including annual flu vaccinations and skin checks. In addition, all staff over 45 have access to an executive yearly health check. All employees have access to Magellan's Employee Assistance Program, a free counselling service for employees and their families.\t

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
Promotion of worker health
column7: Magellan continues to operate in a hybrid work environment where our employees can connect as teams but balance their work and personal commitments. Magellan recognises individual employees have different preferences about working from home and working from the office, but also believes there is great importance for the Company's culture of working together in the office.

column13: Magellan also participates in the annual Workplace Gender Equality Reporting process, which, under the Workplace Gender Equality Act 2012, requires non-public sector employers with 100 or more employees to submit a report to the Workplace Gender Equality Agency ("WGEA"). Magellan's participation meets its Australian compliance obligations and contributes to the WGEA's dataset on gender equality in Australian workplaces. The process also allows us to identify gender equality issues and implement action plans.
column20: Workplace Gender Equality Reporting, Employee, Participation

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: Magellan is focused on ensuring pay equality during hire and through the employee lifecycle. Magellan conducts an annual review of employee remuneration, which includes comparing employees in the same role and with the same level of experience to highlight any pay inequalities and adjusts compensation based on this review if required to ensure that variances in compensation reflect the relative performance of employees.

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column7: Magellan's Workplace Conduct Policy details the Group's approach to harassment in the workplace, including bullying, discrimination, sexual harassment, workplace violence and defamation, and provides procedures for dealing with complaints. On an annual basis, all employees and the Board undertake training to ensure that it is clearly understood what is expected of them in terms of behaviour and conduct in the workplace.

column7: Magellan believes that an active contribution to the community is essential. Over the past financial year, Magellan's employees participated in September, raising funds for Cerebral Palsy, the J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge, and the Bloomberg Square Mile Relay. Magellan and its employees raised money for Equality Australia during Sydney World Pride Week.

column13: Magellan's cybersecurity defence framework is aligned with the Australian Cyber Security Centre's 'Essential Eight framework', and all its strategies have been implemented. Magellan has also mapped its approach to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) cyber security framework. Magellan applies the principle of role-based least privilege concerning data and systems access to ensure staff can only access the minimal data set required to perform their role.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: As an independent assessment of the Group's cybersecurity protection, Magellan engages an external consulting firm specialising in IT security to conduct annual' penetration testing' of the Group's environment. Magellan maintains a Cybersecurity Incident Response Plan that is tested annually and contains defined security roles, responsibilities, and procedures to follow if an event should ever occur.
column20: Penetration Testing, IT Security, Cybersecurity Incident Response Plan

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Third-party risk management is a critical component of Magellan's information security program. All third-party relationships undergo a rigorous security risk assessment as part of the due diligence process before being engaged. It includes an evaluation of their cybersecurity posture and data privacy/data access controls. The Group annually repeats the technology-focused due diligence process for all critical third-party service providers.\t
column20: Third-party Risk Management, Security risk assessment, Due Diligence
